item.description:
Jim Nelson will show the film "1946 Cape Cod Forest Fire" 

This is a silent, color film taken during the April 19-23, 1946 fire that burned 15,000 acres from the Cape Cod Canal east through Bourne, Sandwich, Mashpee and Barnstable.

The fire was fought by fire crews and equipment responding from 62 Massachusetts towns and the National Guard. Due to dry conditions, on Sunday, April 21, 1946, 23 other fires ignited in eastern Massachusetts.

This film is a good reminder that April is the most dangerous time of the year for wildfires in southeastern Massachusetts.

All are welcome to view the film and then stay for the monthly meeting of the FMSSF board that will meet at 7:00 PM. Coffee and cookies will be served.
item.how_to_find_us: Conference Building, across the street from MSSF Headquarters

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Showing of a film of the 1946 Cape Cod Forest Fire before the FMSSF Board Mtg.
